info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 2:48PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Routt and southeastern Moffat Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a several strong thunderstorms 7 miles south of Craig, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Craig. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 73 and 110. Colorado 13 between mile markers 74 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
